concept.title: Getting and Setting IP Addresses Tutorial
concept.shortdesc: This topic describes how to get and set IP addresses.

section.title: Introduction
section.p: To establish a connection with the host, the IP addresses must be determined and set. The IP address can be local or remote. This tutorial describes the following:

p.xref: How to Get a Local IP Address
How to Get a Remote IP Address
How to Set the Local IP Address

section.p: Note: Usually IP address are automatically allocated to client applications when a dial-up connection is established.

section.title: How to Get a Local IP Address
section.p: The RSocket::LocalName() function is used to get the local IP address and the port.

section.title: How to Get a Remote IP Address
section.p: The RSocket::RemoteName() function is used to get the remote IP address and the port

section.title: How to Set the Local IP Address
section.p: The RSocket::Bind() function is used to set the local IP address and the port. This call must be made by server applications before calling RSocket::Listen(). To get and set the IP address, the anAddr argument must be of the class . TInetAddr.
